notesStmt.note: A note in an Italian semi-cursive hand of the 17th-18th century, folio 354r. On the other side of the sheet is the address: J. Moreno, [...] Ferrara, the name Abram Bolafia being written on the side. Domenico Carretto: Italian censor (active in the first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name, 1617; see 100-101; folio 352v. Censored by Domenico Irosolimitano, Italian censor (active in the last quarter of the 16th and first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name (folio 353r); see 61. Alessandro Scipione: Italian censor (a convert Jew, active in the last quarter of the 16th and first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name, 1592 (folio 353v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Rashi on Bava batra and Bava metsi῾a, and the commentary of Gershom ben Judah on Bava batra.

collation.p: 1st quire of 8 leaves: folios 2-10; 34 quires of 10 leaves each: folios 11-350; 35th quire of 3 leaves: folios 351-353. Folio 1 is a paper flyleaf, and folios 354-355 are also an extraneous addition of paper leaves. Catchwords at the end of the quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 14th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Solomon Yitschaki. Comm. on Baba Kamma. Etc. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,196.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 310: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [357v].
